body:
Hello @jbrockmendel! Thanks for submitting the PR.

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`asv_bench/benchmarks/period.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/f3d332142b3272bb5764168f862cafdfdfead110/asv_bench/benchmarks/period.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/base.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/f3d332142b3272bb5764168f862cafdfdfead110/pandas/core/indexes/base.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/multi.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/f3d332142b3272bb5764168f862cafdfdfead110/pandas/core/indexes/multi.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/core/indexes/period.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/f3d332142b3272bb5764168f862cafdfdfead110/pandas/core/indexes/period.py) !

 - There are no PEP8 issues in the file [`pandas/util/testing.py`](https://github.com/jbrockmendel/pandas/blob/f3d332142b3272bb5764168f862cafdfdfead110/pandas/util/testing.py) !

 - Complete extra results for this file :

> file_to_check.py:2454:-258: W605 invalid escape sequence '\('
file_to_check.py:2454:-255: W605 invalid escape sequence '\)'
---

And the same question as on the other PR: to what extent is this conflicting with the PeriodArray PR of @TomAugspurger ? Shouldn't we rather focus on finishing that one first, and then doing some perf improvements / clean-ups afterwards?

> Shouldn't we rather focus on finishing that one first, and then doing some perf improvements

@jorisvandenbossche @TomAugspurger responding to many of joris's comments/questions (here and in #23093) in one place.

The PeriodIndex/PeriodArray constructors are a pain point in large part because its `_simple_new` is not very simple, which is why there is the lower-level `_from_ordinals`.  Why the complication in `_simple_new`?  Because the values being passed to it are sometimes i8 (what we actually want), sometimes `ndarray[object]`, and sometimes `PeriodIndex`.  The latter two cases, as it turns out, are coming from calls to `_shallow_copy`, exactly the ones this PR affects.

i.e. following this PR, we'll be able to clean up the `PeriodIndex` constructors (on top of whats in #23093)

> And of course, we can then still try to simplify the different constructors in PeriodArray.

That's fair.  I am definitely viewing the situation as "#22862 is a big PR and simplifying things before that will make that PR smaller, review easier, etc"

> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23095?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [c8ce3d0...62f0f1f](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23095?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
Sorry, I still don't see how introducing this `_take_values` brings us closer to our goal. The PeriodArray PR will remove that again, no?

I think this idea is that they'll all just be `.values` once we have
PeriodArray / DatetimeArray.

On Fri, Oct 12, 2018 at 7:50 AM Jeff Reback <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> *@jreback* requested changes on this pull request.
>
> I don't agree this will be short lived. This is a new notion, meaning we
> now have
> ------------------------------
>
> In pandas/core/indexes/base.py
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23095#discussion_r224771799>:
>
> > @@ -763,6 +763,17 @@ def get_values(self):
>          """
>          return self.values
>
> +    @property
> +    def _take_values(self):
> +        """
> +        Values to use in `take` operation, suitable to being passed back to
> +        _shallow_copy/_simple_new.
> +        """
> +        if is_period_dtype(self):
> +            # Avoid casting to object-dtype
> +            return self._ndarray_values
> +        return self.values
>
> this is basically .asi8 on Indexes now, yes? Is there a reason we are not
> aligning on that? or changing .asi8 to this?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/23095#pullrequestreview-164225426>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABQHIgYuFBTeDDuieFgaOcWO-fKYWR-cks5ukJAegaJpZM4XYCM1>
> .
>

> I don't agree this will be short lived. 

> I think this idea is that they'll all just be `.values` once we have PeriodArray / DatetimeArray.

I tend to agree with Tom on this one, but the more important point in my book is that this fixes the weird arguments being passed to PeriodIndex._shallow_copy which allows us to clean up the constructor mess, simplifying the PeriodArray transition.
if they will be .values then don’t introduce something new
Yah, I'm beginning to agree.  Plenty of other related stuff to focus on.  Closing.
